thread.title: Houston girl, 8, shot to death after car crash
thread.title_full: Houston girl, 8, shot to death after car crash

author: MINYVONNE BURKE
title: Houston girl, 8, shot to death after car crash
text:
Houston girl, 8, shot to death after driver chasing vehicle that struck her mom’s car opens fire Houston girl, 8, shot to death after car crash NEW YORK DAILY NEWS   4:36 PM 
An 8-year-old girl was shot and killed early Saturday in Houston, just moments after she was involved in a car crash with her mother. 
DeMaree Atkins was sitting in the backseat of her mother Toyia Thomas’ Honda Accord as it headed east on Sam Houston Parkway when a white Pontiac slammed into the vehicle. 
The Houston Police Department and Homicide Division said it believes the Pontiac was being chased by a black sedan as it traveled at a high speed on West Fuqua St. near the Beltway feeder road at 2:30 a.m., KHOU reports. 
After the crash, authorities said the driver of the sedan got out of the vehicle and opened fire, hitting Atkins. A car crash and shooting in Houston resulted in the death of an 8-year-old girl. (ABC 7 Chicago) 
The young girl was rushed to Memorial Hermann Hospital, where she died. Thomas was also taken to the hospital. 
According to Thomas, the dark sedan came to a stop after the crash. 
"I looked over and thought she was trying to help," she told ABC 13 . "She pulled a gun out of the window and she started shooting." 
"Each one of those bullets hit the back of my car where my baby was," she said. "I pulled her out of the car; I didn't even know she had been hit. I thought she was still asleep." 
Off-duty cop killed, sergeant critically injured in Bronx crash 
Thomas said she laid her daughter on the ground and that's when she noticed Atkin's jacket was stained with blood. 8 yo girl killed by gunfire off the Beltway in SW Houston. Her mother is making a plea that the killer come forward @abc13houston pic.twitter.com/rSVdIlaVRW — Marla Carter (@MarlaABC13) February 25, 2017 
"I pulled her shirt up, and she got shot — the bullet went in the right and came out the left side," Thomas said. 
Authorities are searching for the drivers of the Pontiac and the dark sedan after they fled the scene of the crime. 
In an emotional video posted on YouTube, Thomas said she missed her daughter and pleaded with those responsible to come forward. 
"I love you and I wish I could hug and kiss you ... comb your hair," she said crying. "She loved to go shopping too. She called herself a fashionista. Wish I could polish her nails, her toenails. Anything. I miss my baby." Tags:
